text: Tasty coffee-ish stout on tap at World Beer "Museum" in Osaka (Umeda). Crisp, clean, slight walnut tree type smell. Great head that lasts a while. Super dark; light does not penetrate even when help up to lights. Traditional roasted nut and coffee flavors. Saliva glands respond well. Will definitely drink many more of these. Top shelf!

Wonderful aroma of rich malts. Pours dark brown with lots of tan head. Smokey taste upfront with a thick mouthfeel. Finishes with the standard malts of a stout. Some bitter tobacco taste. Well done. Bottle.

bottle shared that poured almost black with mocha head. deep rich roasted malts with hints of chocolate and coffee on the nose. the flavor was creamy smooth the malts, chocolate, coffee blended so nicely together. full mouth feel the warmer the better.

Taster at brewpub. Pours deep deep tan, brown head. Smells of cark chocolate and smoke and coffee. Good initial hit of burnt malt and coffee, but its a little thin for the abv. Very drinkable for a strong beer. Decent.

Appearance: Deep Blackish Brown. Thin ring of tan bubbles. 
Nose: Deeply roasted malt notes. Coffee, chocolate, toffee, roasted nuts. earthy
Taste: Rich black coffee and dark chocolate notes. just a touch of sweetness. Good bitter
Body: medium. Thinner than anticipated
Parting thoughts: I was very excited to try this beer. It did not disappoint. A very solid classic stout.

$4.99 bomber from Total Wine. Pours thick and black with a small dark brown head. Aroma of coffee and chocolate, roasted malts, slightly sweet, slightly earthy. Flavor is a medium smoked peat, dark chocolates, coffee, hints of licorice. Damn good stuff.
On tap at Pike Brewing. Balanced, smooth and delicious, the roasted flavours are dialled back and this is very drinkable.

TAP.
Good black pour with tan head..
Dark burnt malt nose, some aniseed is faint..
Solid dark base, burnt wood, some coffee & dark choc bitterness to finish.. Sourced pike brewery
On tap, Pike Pub. Jet black colour, off white foam. Very good this, not overly harsh or boozy despite abv, smooth roasty coffee and cocoa flavours and a long bitter finish. Impressive stuff.

Poured from 22 oz. bottle. Near-black with a 2-finger tan head and very good lacing. Aroma of dark chocolate, roasted malt and roasted coffee with a little licorice and dark fruit. Taste of roasted malt, dark chocolate, toffee, dark fruit, roasted coffee and licorice. Medium/full body and medium carbonation. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
(tap) clear very dark brown colour with a small brown head, creamy palate, aroma of smoked fruit, jam, then chocolate, coffee, rich balanced flavour with a long light bitter finish

650ml bottle. Pours an opaque black with a large, creamy, long lasting, brown head that leaves plenty of lacing. Sweet aroma of roasted malt, dark chocolate, coffee and a hint of smoke. Sweet flavour of roasted malt, coffee, licorice and dark chocolate with a dry, mildly bitter finish. Medium body with a creamy, oily texture and soft carbonation. Very nice.
Black with a thick and creamy tan head. Aroma is espresso. Flavor is espresso. I think they gave me a shot of espresso instead of a beer. But in all seriousness, this is a great stout.
Quite good. Bomber. Rich nose of cocoa and licorice. Oily thick palate with anise taste. Gritty and grainy and roasted notes too. Well balanced and complex.
Tap at Pike. Dark dense oily pour with a tan head. Harsh roast bitter notes. Rich flavor. Nice.
UPDATED: JUN 21, 2016 On tap at Pike brewery: delicious stout. Roasted coffee and chocolate finish outlasts smooth but hoppy start.
Easily the best beer Josh and I tried at the brewery in 2016. Assertive maltiness. Lots of coffee, some licorice, dark chocolate, and wood.
Poured from the tap. Near black with tan head. Coffee and chocolate nose. Taste starts with chocolate, leads to coffee, finishes with ash. Fairly full body.

Draftv at the brewery with Mikey Reeves. Great northwest styled stout with a good hop bitter kick but also some coffee and chocolate. Lingering bitter finish. Very nice, especially if you like hops.

Draft at AK BW fest 2016. Black color, big brown head. Coffee grounds aroma. Taste has coffee grounds and cocoa powder, dry finish.

Black pour with a thin beige head and light sticky lacing .... Aroma of vanilla, roasted malts, chocolate malts and licorice with some dark fruits ..... Pours a finger of tan head on a black body.
The aroma is black licorice, smoke, anise, roasted malt and coffee. Nice.
The taste is coffee bitter, a touch of smoke and a little malt sweetness.
The texture is thicker.
This is an amazing stout.
650ML bottle from target. Deep dark color with coffee and chocolate flavour. Smooth and balanced. I drink it with Jalapeno chips!

Bottle from Pike Brewing, Seattle very kindly brought back from the US of A by my cousins other arf. Pours black with a tan head. Dark chocolate, licorice, coffee and vanilla aroma. Flavours of licorice (dominates), coffee and dark chocolate. Very smooth. Nicely balanced. Light smoky-bitter edge in the finish. Nice.

Bomber. Pours black with a brown head and aroma of strong roasted coffee and malt. Taste is smokey, lots of coffee notes throughout with roasted malt and liquorice leading to a coffee filled, bitter finish. Delicious stout

With Z, a bomber on a football Sunday, pours a pitch black pour with an ephemeral Java head. Nose is deep malt , burnt espresso and light cocoa . Taste is very dry, malty, with some smoke, black licorice and burnt coffee. Finishes on the very dry tasting notes . Quaff Score 7 / 10

Bomber->English pint. Black with thick tan head. A: chocolate malt, faint anise, coffee. T: bitter sweet cocoa, roasted malt, slight smoke. Somewhat dry. Good, if unexciting.

bottle poured into a snifter..black with a fluffy tan head..aroma of chocolate,coffee,oats,roasted nuts..tastes of bitter chocolate,coffee,nuts..
more on the bitter side than most stouts..but still good.

This is a stout that pals a full punch of flavor. Draft pour pint at the brewery. Ive seen this beer around for years but for some reason I passed on it time and time again. Now Im wondering why. Full chocolatey roasted flavor with a lingering cocoa finish. Thick mouthfeel. Id believe it if it was strongerthan 7% but it is in no way boozy. Just has a big beer feel to it. Awesome trip to Pike. Awesome beer here.

Poured in tulip glass from a bomber. Smoky coffee aroma, black and opaque with nice tan head. Flavor of coffee, roasted malt and cocoa, with a pleasantly bitter finish. Very respectable stout worth a try.

On June 25, 2015. At Pike Pub & Brewery in Seattle, Washington.Roasted, sweet, full taste. Liqourice aftertaste. Smooth full mouthfeel, medium bitterness. Black color, brown head. Malty, sweet, roasted scent.
Rich black beer with minimal sweetness. Has a strong scent of dark roasted coffee. Leaves a smooth roasted after flavor.

Bomber from Grocery Outlet. Pours thick and black with a small brownish head on it. Roasted nose with coffee and a bit of licorice. Smell pretty rich, like an impy. Dry up front with a good deal of roasted malts. Coffee and more roast follow. Very stout. No sweetness, just lots of roasty and coffee. Light hops in the finish.
Tap at Pike Brewing, Seattle. Colour is black with slightly brownish white head. Aromas and flavours: Coffee, dark chocolate and roasted malts.

Pitch black with a three finger high brownbeige, fluffy head that leaves lots of lacing on the glass. 

Nose: Espresso, roasted malt, dark chocolate and dried fruit. 
Taste: Coffe, chocolate, red berries, smoke and a lot of hops. 
Body: Medium body with light carbonation. Soft taste with a great bitterness.
Tap at Pike - excellent stout - cream and chocolate sweetness tempered well by deep, but not astringent roast - a hint of smoke and dark fruit - espresso finish - very tasty.

Draft sample, black body, decent head, good lace. Aroma tasted barley and dark fruit. Taste roasted malt, dark fruit, a little ashy? Starts slightly sweet, finishes bitter. Palate a little light, carbonation ok, just slightly sharp for style.
Floral, earthy, chocolate, smokey, espresso goodness. Pours a pitch black with mocha colored head and great lacing.

Draft @ Doubletree in SEA. Roasty aroma. Black color with a hint of ruby on the edges. Off white head, with nice lacing. A nice bitterness in the flavor, with lots of roast notes. Medium bodied. I like it as nice example of an extra stout.

From a bomber that was actually priced correctly. Paired with bacon and espresso. But not bacon espresso..... Yet

Aroma is more hop driven than others. Grassy. Sweet. Just started campfire. Almost like smoked fish ... Mom that bacon Im cooking might be getting in the way. 

Looks fine. Dark. Nice head. Medium body. 

Taste is different. I like it because there are no gimmicks. Metalicy almost like a porter. Grassy. Hops are more prevalent than others. A little sweetness. Very nice as it warms. 

Palate when cold is hop dominated. When approaching room temp it is very balanced and smooth. 

Overall this is a great representation of what I think a generic full bodied stout should be. Solid beer.
Aroma of malt, dark fruit. Smooth, slightly bitter. Tastes like a semi-neutral stout.

Appearance: fulminous near black, hugely thick, creamy chocolate milk-colored head that lasts forever, extensive rings of frothy lace	bitter.  Appearance: not super strong--dark cocoa powder, strong notes of spruce, with some coffee and chalk, and a bit of orange rind. Taste: roasty and bitter, intensely DARK and dry flavors, with chocolate, coffee, resin, a hint of citrus.  Finish: the pine and bakers chocolate are the lasting remnants, with a talc-like dryness coming on. Notes: Cant find anything wrong with this. Truly seems like a hybrid between a dry Irish stout and a Russian imperial stout.

"quite good for an extra stout. obviosly not as big as the massive imperials ive been spoiling my palate with. not a standout, but it also has no weaknesses. good roasted malt/hop balance, nice coffee/malt/cocoa aroma. lingers."
Bottle. Deep brown with a small tan head. Cocoa, dark chocolate and coffee aroma. Some Nutella. Mellow raspberry tart accents. More coffee. Pretty ashy and dry. Slightly thin. Silky. Quality stuff.
22 ounce bottle. Big chocolate roast taste with a slight taste of smoke. Nice looking dark pour and creamy tan head.

Had this beer at two different place in consecutive nights. Its nice, roast with low acidity, nicely dry, natural well balanced malt chocolate. A very clean but loads of well balanced flavor. Well attenauted, no over-the-top characteristics yet rich,. Has a nice big tan head with lots of lacing. Its impressive that this Pikes highest rated beer, most rated beer and is a regularly produced, widely available beer. Kudos.

text: 22oz bomber, aged a year. Tan head, collared. Black bastard color. Boozy alcoholic smell, but tastes like malts, still really bitter after a year, wow roasty/toasty malt, so roasted. Quite good.
Aroma of chocolate and coffee great looking ebony color with a brown well laced head. Dry feel with a bitter chocolate finish, taste of coffee and chocolate.

Black pour under a thin lacy khaki head. The nose is smoky roasty and earthy sweet. The flavor is the same, with predominant notes of toast and dark burnt toast with some bitter chocolate tones and a smoky finish. Light touch of dark roast coffee throughout.

Draft 2/02 (Brewery)-Pours black with a nice brown head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, and roasted malts. Taste of the same with quite a bit of bitterness. This full bodied brew is well balanced and is quite tasty.

Last live review of the night.
I bought one 22 oz. bottle on my way home from roller hockey tonight.
I poured this into a snifter.
The appearance was a deep dark brown close to a black in color with a half fingers worth of an off-white close to a tan colored head. The lacing is sporadic and kinda all over the place.
The smell has a dark and roasty sort of coffee combined ever so delicately with a meaty sort of aspect running through it. Its dry and subtly combines a good strength of chocolate to roasty character all the way through.
The taste takes the coffee and the chocolate and combines exceptionally well through a dryness pummeling my taste buds harshly. The aftertaste is extremely bitter through the coffee notes and adds a decent yet balanced dry to sweet finish. That aftertaste is not exactly what I had hoped for, but anyways, I shall proceed.
On the palate, it sat about a medium to heavy on the body with not much of any sessionability sort of aspect to it. I sipped this one for the most part.
Overall, hey, this is actually a very nice Foreign/Extra Stout and very worthy of having again.

Bottle from Total Wine McLean. Pours Black with a thin khaki head. leaves some lacing in the glass. Im not getting much on the nose. Extremely dry on the tongue with some chocolate being revealed on the finish. Not my favorite interpretation of the style but not boring either.
Pours black with a tan head. Aromas of roasted coffee. Similar flavor plus dark chocolate.

Bottle sent to me by Prufrockstar - thanks Chris! Dark black pour with a nice dark tan head. Roasted malt nose. Strong bitter taste that finishes a little bitter. For some reason this was more pronounced when the beer was colder vs. when it warmed up (much better as it warmed!).
Poured from 22oz bottle. Black pour with tan head. Chocolate and cocoa coffee taste. Mild bitterness. Tasty shit

Boostle via Homer321. T. Hanks, broseph! Pours a thick as tar black, almost no head. Plenty of ass to mouth action, lots of creamy tar, ass drippings, very heavy on the roast. No alcohol detected. This is really my kind of beer. Thick, black, unforgiving yet smooth. I am willing and this black monster is more than ready!

A very nice, complex stout. Pours a deep black with a brown head. Smells awesome, some vanilla and coffee. Taste starts sweet and creamy, with a slightly bitter finish. Had on tap at the brewery.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dark as night. Creamy tan head. Body is full and creamy. Flavor is bitter and roasted burnt flavor with slight espresso. Nice hop character. Had off tap at pike place. Excellent tasting brew!
Pours a nice black with a dark chocolate head. Aroma is full if sweet chocolate malt. Tastes of chocolate and a hint of coffee. A nice sweet malt lingers for a bit. Goes down very smooth.

Dark dark brown pour. Mocha head. Coffee, roast, chocolate aroma, and decent citrus hop presence. Flavor is citrus hops, roasted coffee bean, and medium chocolate. 

---Rated via iPhone

UPDATED: DEC 6, 2013 On tap at St Augustines on The Drive in Vancouver. Almost black with moderate tan head. Rich chocolate and coffee overtones here. Somewhat sweet with a trace of sourness about mid palate, but with a dry, bitter and roasted finish. Superb!

Almost completely black, espresso head. Lots of roasted barley and a hint of chocolate. This is almost a coffee explosion but an overwhelming bitterness and roast qualities that lack any balance. Intense for only 7% abv

Bottle from Total Wine Summerlin, Las Vegas. Black pour. Aroma is roasted, burnt malts, tobacco, ash and some chocolate. Flavor is qite dry and bitter roasted without much hops. Solid roasty malts and nice and clean balance. Good stout.
From a 22 oz bottle shared at home. Pours black with a tan head. Chocolate nose. Cocoa, coffee and licorice flavors. Really nice stout.
Draft at the brewery. Nice chocolaty aroma. Mmmmm. Full bodied and thick. Some roasted malt flavors. Incredible texture like an oatmeal stout. espresso implications.
September 2012. Sampled at the brewpub in Seattle. Very dark brown with a nice tan head. Coffee, chocolate, roasted malt atomas with a hint of smoke. Good balance and a bitter finish.
This beer has wonderful coffee flavor but is not overly creamy possibly due to the use of Carafa III or similar malt in this beer.

black, tan head with moderate retention. dark fruit, soy sauce, chocolate, smoke, slightly cola-like. medium-heavy bitter, medium sweet, some salt and savory. medium-full body, slick feel, soft carb, dry finish

One of the best stouts around. Pours thick with a brown head. Aromas of coffee are evident first, however Chocolate bursts through on the first sip. Caramel and treacle notes lingers in the body. High ABV, however it is masked well by the sweetness of the dark malts. Fantastic. Best off the tap at the brewery itself.
Black pour, small brown head. Roasy aroma. Rich chocolaty roasty flavor. Delicious!

This is a really nice beer with a good combination of stout characteristics. It is strong with a licorice taste like an imperial, but it has the dryness of an Irish. It has a nice coffee flavor that you would expect from Seattle and a good color. This could very well be Seattles Best.

Bottle, 22oz. It pours a more or less black body, topped by a dense, light tan head that lasts and leaves lacings. The aroma is deliciously dark, with treacle, roasted malts, dark chocolate, coffee and some dried fruits. Some citrusy notes shines through as well. The flavor is equally good, sweet but not too sweet, the bitterness is balancing, and some alcohol warmth can be felt. Full body, and very soft carbonation. The finish stays for a good while, leaving your mouth covered with sweet, roasted maltyness. Glad I bought this one, it was certainly worth a visit. 130703
On tap at Pikes Pub, pour is dark black with slight red tone, strong palate, roasted flavor. Taste is good but not everything that a stout can be.

Refrigerated brown bomber poured into a English pint.  Pours black with huge medium brown head (may be the darkest head I have seen).  Thick body, excellent velvet texture, medium body, and slightly roasty/coffee aroma. Taste is roasty, bakers chocolate, salty, and really dry finish  Definitely should be a dry stout and the best I have had.
7% shared by Mick at the World Beer Museum. Great Chocolate aroma and a nice black pour with a dark brown head. A wonderful creamy smooth mouthfeel, bitter with a lasting aftertaste. Quite nice.

Pours a dark oik like color with an active chocolate hued head that leaves some light lacing as it goes down. Roasted malts, some sweet fruit with a hint of chocolate. The taste has more a more pronounced coffee note. With a slightly dry finish. Good stuff.

Pike XXXXX Stout has a thin-to-medium tan head and a very dark brown, almost black appearance, but with visible bubble streams, upon close inspection. Lacing is scant. The aroma is of heavily-roasted barley malt, dark brown bread crust, and sweetness. Flavor is of deep, dark, astringent, roasted barley malt, a good amount of bitterness, sweetness, and some chocolate and coffee. Mouthfeel is medium to heavy, and Pike XXXXX Stout finishes mostly wet, heavy, sweet, and rich. This is a sipper. Overall, I score it most excellent. Glad I tried it! RJT

Dark pour one finger dark brown head that lingers.  Aroma of astringent roasts, sweet cinnamon, long pepper, and grassy hops.  Bitter grassy hops dominate the flavor profile initially and it is quite dry and moderate/comparatively light mouth feel.  The aftertaste of coffee and roasts is quite pleasant though.
Pours a thick motor oil black with little head.  Lots of dark chocolate, smoke and earthy aroma.  Taste is heavily roast malt and chocolate.  A nice stout, no doubt

Very nice stout. Coffee aroma following a thick black frothy pour. A quite roasty stout, with pronounced coffee taste and to a lesser extent chocolate. Recommended!

Bottle sample at a tasting at the new Beer & Beyond shop. Thanks Naama. Pours black with brown head, sweetish vanilla, alcohol and toffee aroma,tastes stoutish sour and very nice, nice, smooth, long finish.

Bottle. Dark w decent tan head. Full aroma of chocolate malt and a hint of coffee. Think and dry stout. Full bodied with lots of roasty goodness. Touch of bitterness but not hoppy. A very good and solid stout.

Black as night with a good tannish-brown head and good lacing.

Aroma is roasty and a little burnt with nice coffee and chocolate notes.

Flavor follows through with the nose, maybe with a touche of anise (but its subtle).  The chocolate and coffee are a bit more pronounced, leaving a slightly cappuccino effect for the imbiber.

Body is full, thick, rich, and leaves a wonderful slightly roasted, slightly burnt aftertaste that I really enjoy in a stout.

Definitely recommended.  Ill for sure buy this one again.
Pours black with tan head and nice lacing.  Aroma of roasted malts.  Taste is dark malts, coffee, licorice, and toffee.  Very tasty stout.

Bottle sample at a tasting at the new Beer & Beyond shop. Thanks Naama. Black-colored with a light brown head. Nice roasty aroma with some coffee and light cocoa hints. Bittersweet roasty flavor with a long bitter finish with some hops and burnt wood notes. Medium to full-bodied.
Bottle. Poured black with cream head. Good and dry like a Guinness but boosted nicely by the Imp. character. Lots of roasted malt character and finishes with a nice bite. Pretty good stout.

Poured a deep black brown color with a nice tan head. Aroma is chocolate, coffee, toffee, caramel, nuts, faint smoke and toast. Taste is chocolate, coffee, nuts, and very smooth with low carbonation. Pretty good average stout.

Bottle. Dark brown, almost black.Thick dark brown head. Nose is roasted malts, dark berries, coffee, chocolate. Taste is roasted malts, chocolate, some dark fruits. Bitter, somewhat astringent finish.  Creamy mouthfeel,like an oatmeal stout.

651mL thanks to craftycarl21! Old bottle, we were thinking about 4 years old. Pours clear deep cola, reddish foam. No lace. Green olive nose straight up. Bomber from LetsPour.com. Nose is chocolate, roast,and coffee. Black with a medium cinnamon tan head. Flavor is lightly bitter, roasted coffee, and chocolate. The finish is lightly bitter with a hint of smoke eventually showing up.

Pouts a black brown color with a large beady brown head. Notes of roasted malt, dark chocolate, Oreo
Cookie, and a little bit of

Pours pitch black color with small head. Aroma of liquorice, mocha, chocolate and dark fruits. Flavour of chocolate, mocha, liquorice, malts and ripe fruits. Nice smooth palate, dry finish.

text: Sample at the brewpub. Pours an opaque black with a brownish head. Aroma has chocolate, caramel and a bit of fruit. Taste is chocolate, expresso, malty caramel. Somewhat sweet also a bit rough. Finishes long and somewhat sweet. Solid stout.

Bottle from trade with Michaelinwa.  Pours a very dark brown color with a small amount of bubbly beige head that quickly fades.  Aroma is a nice balance of tobacco, chocolate, espresso, raisins, and a bit of burnt sugar and smoke.  Very nice smooth taste, lots of tobacco and chocolate. From iphone beerlicious app:  Black with a nice brown frothy head.  Light bitterness with a hint of sweet.  Medium body with a creamy slick texture.

Dark brown pour with medium sized tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee, chocolate and slight smoke. Taste of dark roasted malts, coffee, unsweetened chocolate, cocoa and a dry hop bitterness finish. Medium bodied with a velvety smooth mouthfeel.

An inital nose of caramel and coffee. Upon a taste the beer gives a deep rich flavor with coffee, caramel and a slight hint of hops and then yields to a cocoa finish.

Excellent stout

Pours a dark inky black with a big foamy brown head. Great head retention and I good amount of lace that hangs on the glass. 
Smells of dark roast coffee and burnt cocoa with a little sweetness of toffee. Tastes like dark chocolate and toffee and finishes with a great bitterness. Really impressed with this offering from Pike.

April 18th, 2010 - For all the tripels and wheats out and available in stories, the stout is one of the best beers for the cold, drawn out, bone chilling Seattle days. Theres a demand for the dark stuff when everything else is in grayscale, and Pike is ready to serve it up. The head is a lacy cinnamon brown color, and the dark black body gives off a sweet perfume of cinnamon, coffee, dark chocolate and fresh leather. It smells rugged, maybe even manly. The flavor is delivered on a medium heavy body with a healthy carbonation and excellent balance. Theres a bitter dimension, but its not heavy handed. Like the aroma, the flavor is spicy and rugged, with a sharp alcoholic taste, and a robust strength that lifts the drinker past the malaise of Seattles weather into fine spirits. While Im not a devotee of Pikes other offerings, their stout is always a welcome beer in my glass.

Chocolate malt and coffee in the aroma.  Flavor starts slightly sweet with caramel and toffee.  Roast, smoke, and coffee bitterness in the finish.  Creamy mouthfeel.  Really good.
Very darj nice color, tasteful head. Very String and lovely smokey taste. You can really feel the chocolate, too.... I like it.

My favorite of the samples I had at the pub. This pours inky black with a foamy tan head. The aroma is full of chocolate, coffee, some caramel and a hint of roast malt. The flavor is similar. Everything blends together quite well.
Tap @ the brewpub. Nice creamy head with excellent duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are rich roast malt, chocolate, coffee, and hops. Dry and pleasant long bitter finish. World class!

Pours a deep rich black color with a two finger mocha colored head.  Aromas are roasted malts, chocolate and spent coffee grounds... flavors follow the nose with touches of licorice, bitter chocolate and a creamy long lasting finish.
Very nice brew.  Pours black with a dark tan head.  Huge chocolate roasted aroma.   Medium bodied and silky.  Finish is dry and chocolaty.  Good stuff.

Aroma is typical to an English stout with roastiness, some coffee, English hops and hints of vanilla. Flavour has toffee and English hops. Finishes dry with roasted malt, licorice and coffee. Flawless and good.
160712. Tap at the pike brewing. Pours blacl with a nice head. Aroma roasted malts, coffee, nuts. Slightly dry taste. Medium palate. Not Bad.

650ml bottle pours black in color with a finger of light brown head that leaves some spotty lacing on the glass.  Aroma is roasted barley, chocolate and coffee with hints of smoke.  Taste is chocolate malty sweetness with a roasted barley and coffee bitterness.  Medium to heavy bodied with mild carbonation.  Quite an enjoyable brew which is a definite must try.

22 ounce bottle poured a nice black color, aromas of roasted malt and chocolate.  Flavor is the same, solid and true to the style, wouldnt mind keeping a few bottles on hand, in case I just want a classic stout.
This is a good solid stout. A bit on the burnt side for me- which resembles a porter. But the malts are very nice. Low carbonation.
Deep brown, nearly black with a light brown foam. Aromas of chocolate and toffee. Good body with chocolate and roasted flavor. Some smokiness that finishes dry and slightly bitter.

Pours black with tan head that dissipates quickly. Aroma is mild malts, smoke, coffee and chocolate. Taste is bitter chocolate, roast malt, black coffee. medium body and dry palate, finish is long lasting bitter chocolate and strong coffee, dry

Draft at the brewery with Linh. Pours a deep black body with light reddish tint and nice creamy, chocolate brown lacing. Aroma is light chocolate. Mouthfeel is medium with notes of chocolate and light roasted malts. Ok, solid stout.

On tap at the brewpub. Dull black in the pint with a half inch or so of brown head. Lots of roast to the aroma; also a bit of coffee, bit of chocolate as you would expect from a stout. Very earthy, grainy taste, very dry, very delicious. Sharp bitter finish. Great lingering aftertaste and lasting, comforting boozy warmth .
Im definitely getting the coffee thats in this one, but not much of the smokiness. Its relatively easy on the palate. Pours with next to no head, and the few bubbles you get are brown.

(22 oz. from Grain and Vine) Pours very dark brown with a half a finger or less of tan head. Aroma of chocolate and coffee roast. Mouthfeel very smooth, beefy, slightly oily. Flavor of chocolate, bitter and sweet. Coffee roast emerges on back end. Lingering bitter chocolate aftertaste.

22 ounce bottle into tulip glass, no bottle dating.  Pours pitch black color with an impressive 2 finger dense tan head with great retention, that reduces to a thick cap that lasts.  Some nice thick soapy lacing clings to the glass.  Aromas of big dark chocolate, black coffee, roasted malt, pine, toasted biscuit, herbal, citrus rind, and earthy hops.  Very nice and well balanced aromas with good strength.  Taste of big dark chocolate, espresso, pine, grapefruit, roasted malt, toast, herbal, char, and earthy hops.  Good sized roasted coffee bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of dark chocolate, espresso, pine, charred malt, and herbal on the finish for a good bit.  Very nice balance of roasted and hoppy flavors.  Medium carbonation and body; with a nice creamy and fairly slick mouthfeel.  Alcohol is well hidden with only a warming noticed after the finish.  Quite smooth to drink, but is still a bit of a sipper.  Overall this is a really excellent export stout!  Great flavor balance with hoppiness; and quite smooth to sip on, with big robust flavors.
On draft at the brewery.  Dark black with a light tan head.  Nice roastiness with chocolate and hops.  Nice.
Black color with chocolate brown foam. Bitter chocolate smell and taste, something else, but cant place it. Interesting beer. Bitter long lasting aftertaste.  (Houston 201205)
Fan-tastic beer! If youre at the brewpub try the chocolate truffles made with this stout.
Bottle in Seattle. Decent roast flavors - seems a pretty one-sided stout though.
This was a great stout that I really enjoyed. I dont normally like a lot of hops, but this worked well. I liked it a lot.
This is a nice stout that reminded me a bit of Bells Expedition stout with its hoppy profile. Dark, frothy, bitter and hoppy with chocolate notes. Very nice.
thats what im talking about. deep ruby in color with a lust deep tan head.  aroma is molasses.  taste is deep roasted malt with a great coffe finish.  im partial to the style and this is a nice one.

Poured from a 22oz bottle into a trumpet glass to drink.  The beer had a black color with a medium-small, creamy, dark tan head with low retention and cling.  The aroma featured chocolate malt, a bit of coffee, yeast, and some grainy hops.  It was very bitter and grainy in taste with only a slight sweet chocolate flavor.  The beer was thin and a bit syrupy with average wetness, low carbonation and fizz, a touch of cream, and a noticeable presence of alcohol.

Very dark brown to black with some ruby hues.  Brown and mocha colored head with lots of lacing.  Aroma of cocoa along with some earthy scents. Taste is a little on the bitter side, especially in the finish.  Was not as impressed as I expected to be based on the overall ratings.

Appearance was jet black with a diminishing tannish creamy 1 finger head and no lacing.Aromas where biscuity caramel chocolaty malts with no hints of hops or alcohol. Taste was sweet coco, caramely roasty toasty malts.Hops where hardly eiable with clean yeasts. Mouthfeel was full thick body with creamy carbonation and everlasting smooth finish. Mmmmm chewy...

from 22oz. bottle.  appears black with small brown head which fades quickly.  roasted malt aroma.  full bodied with medium carbonation and a bit sweet.  tastes of coffee, chocolate and cereal.  dark chocolate finish.  very good.
Quite decent.  A well balanced and flavorful stout.  Robust and chocolaty.  Possibly overrated.  Happy with the 7% abv and i got a bomber for 3.99 so i cant complain.

1/15/12. 22oz bottle. Opaque black pour with a small brown head that fades fast and laces a little in small rings. Sweet chocolate aroma with touches of char and ash. Slightly sweet chocolate entry that transitions to char, roasted coffee, and lingering dryness with a touch of tartness. Not too shabby.

opaque black with some tan bubbles around the rim.  full body with medium-high carbonation, and not creamy or clingy.

aroma: silage, mushroom soy sauce, some roasted malts, and a hint of charcoal.

taste: charcoal, roasted malts, roasted barley, some sourness and herbal hops. very little chocolate or coffee. truly a foreign extra stout or "imperial" dry irish stout.

one of the best dry style stouts ive had @ 1200 ratings.
Bottle.  Black with a creamy light brown head.  Chocolate coffee cereal grain and lightly burnt malt aroma and taste with a dry finish.
Charbon, café, malt rôti, torréfie avec un fini très sec. La charpente est assez mince, rien de terriblement excitant mais la buvabilité est excellente.

Deep, dark, with robust brown head. Aroma is complex, sweet, roasty, yeasty....very nice. Flavor leans towards roasted grain, but very well balanced with sweeter malt with chocolate notes. A really impressive stout, and so far my favorite by American brewers, and maybe my favorite overall. Definitely one to come back to many times.

A very nice deep black stout.  Lacking complex flavor and much of an aroma (But how many beers really have great aromas?  This isnt wine.).  However, much of its lack of complexity it makes up for as an outstanding pure blue color stout.  Its drinkable, a little bitter, dark black, roasted, with moderate alcohol flavor and content.  

Simple on the palate, low on the hops.  Perfect for cold weather or the pool.  The pool might seem weird but it is not too thick, richly flavored, or high alcohol content (ie. can consume copiously) but can enjoy cold and warm (I live in Texas - if you drink outdoors in the summer your beer is cold after 90 seconds).

22 oz bottle from the back of the closet...probably about 18 months old from Belmont Station in Portland.  Pours almost black....definite taste of coffee and chocolate...nice balance; not at all bitter but just an edge there...very tasty...well done / wish I had a few more tucked away...

On tap.  Delicious, delicious.  Pours near black with a good head that is as dark as I have ever seen.  Aromas of roasted malt, chocolate.  Smooth, smooth drinking.  Alcohol is totally hidden.  Wonderful balance.  Just great.

This black creamy stout is huge in flavor but not in alcohol. Packed with deep toasty malt and bitter bakers chocolate, Pike extra stout is both mild enough to drink a whole bomber, and wicked enough to stand up to a charred steak on the Barbie. Opaque with a thick resilient tan head, the aroma is a melange of caramel and chocolate malts with hops being nearly undetectable. Finishes dark and very bitter with a light sweetness on the fade. A hearty beer for a cool fall evening.

bottle-pours almost pitch black with a dark cola appearance with a small tan fizzy head around the rim of the glass-big black licorice, anise and dark chocolate on the nose-not much roast.  dank char flavors with lingering burnt notes with some milk chocolate/baking chocolate sweetness in there.  however, as the beer warmed, it became more char-ish.  body is mjedium and perfect for this beer.  not a small stout but not an imperial-exactly how they advertise it!  Overall, im pretty impresed but i would like to thy this one fresh.

Sweet dark cocoa aroma.  Black in color with a thick caramel head.  Bittersweet cocoa flavor with some dried fruit and espresso notes.  Overall, really awesome and tasty.  Plus, for the price I paid, it was a value to boot!

This was great. Pours almost black, with a brown head. Aromas of chocolate, and dark coffee. Taste is a bit one dimensional: strong, dark chocolate, mild coffee, molasses, and caramel. Actually a stout where the sweetness takes over the more bitter coffee flavors. Heavy beer, but still easy to drink. This stuff is very tasty.

650 ml bottle

I dont know why it has taken so long to get around to opening this. If I had known how good it was I would have gotten around to my only bottle a long time ago. Even after a year in the cellar it is holding up quite well. Considering the price this is an excellent value for those who can get it on the West Coast.

Aroma / Appearance - The black body was very lazy as it flowed from the bottle into my goblet. With a dense head it played the part of stout as well as any other beer that I have ever run across. Dark chocolate, raisins, anise, and the smell of a thick truffle blend effortlessly into a contemplative and heady experience.

Flavor / Palate - Rich black coffee immediately hits the tongue. Following closely behind is a mouthful of bitter grounds and smoke. The dry finish invites another sip until eventually there is no more. A robust example of the style this affordable release is another gem from Pike and reminds me why I need to get out there again at some point.

22 oz from malt and vine, redmond WA. poured a very creamy rich black. head was light but brown in color. aroma was rich of cocoa and smoked flavors. first sip brought in chocolate, coffee and caramel mixed perfectly, but a sense of a smoke feeling to it. actually first sip was with 30 seconds left in a the ND vs Michigan game in the first night game ever at Michigan with ND scoring when I cracked the bottle. delicious after taste with a mouthful of coffee roast with creamy rich feeling on the tounge
Long finish, reasonable balance on a deep-roasted stout, avoiding going too far with the suggestion of tobacco or celery seed--notes I pick up a bit here. Not especially rich. (on tap at brewpub)
Pours jet black, very bubbly head. Coffee, smoke. Little hoppy, bitter finish. A smooth, sweet stout
Black with creamy tan head. Lots of roasty toasty chocolate. Pretty mild nose overall.  Medium body. Flavors of licorice, coffee, chocolate, and smoke. Well done, but not my bag.

Pours pitch black with a large, fluffy, milk chocolate colored head. Smells strongly of chocolate and has touches of coffee. Tastes of chocolate, almost exclusively. Full-bodied with a smooth texture and soft mouth-carbonation, Pike XXXX Stout finishes bittersweet.
Tap @ brewpub. Dark brown appearance with a brown head. Roasty, espresso, somewhat nutty, dark malty nose. Creamy mouth feel. Somewhat bitter  roasty, espresso flavor. Pretty tasty.

Bottle 650ml (from brewery, sampled at home)
Dark opaque black color, good creamy brown head, some lace. Strong roasted malty aroma. Medium to full bodied. Roasted malty flavor with salty licorice. Peat/tar notes. Long roasted aftertaste. Well-brewed, balanced strong stout, but perhaps too dry to get really top score in my list.

(Thanks to Vertical Bacon Strips for this world class beer!)  The look : Black in color with a big brown head.  The nose : Wow!  Roasted coffee beans, smoke, dark chocolate, vanilla and burnt notes.  Definitly some fruity hops.  The taste : Dark malts and coffee, caramel and Belgian chocolate.  Truly a real pleasure!  The mouthfeel : Wonderful(l) body.  Smooth carbonation with a perfect oily texture.  The finale : Roasted and hoppy, piney notes and great coffee beans.  The appreciation : An outstanding stout!

Bouteille (merci Patrick) Visuel: Liquide noire comme une nuit sans lune, mousse brune durable. Olfactif: Nez de poisson fumé, chocolat. Gustatif: Le liquide est huileux, la texture est grasse, les saveurs sont prononcées de café grillé. Résumé: Un bon stout, gras et imposant. 7/10

Bottle. To paraphrase the old Folgers commercial, we took this mans beer and replaced it with used motor oil. Pours about as black and oily as Ive ever seen a stout pour. No head, just a light ring. Nose is coffee, cocoa, and an incongruous floral note -- lavender? Flavor is strongly mocha and coffee, almost but not quite burnt; mouthfeel is lighter than I expected given the pour. Its good, but lets be honest; in stouts, you have to be great to stand out.

Having no prior knowledge of this stout, I found it a pleasant surprise. 750 ml bottle poured at about 8C into pint glass. Poured very dark brown with a darkish tan head. Pleasant aroma that paralleled taste of malt, dark chocolates and subtle coffees. Palate was smooth at the front end and, as described in the commercial description, pleasantly bitter and dry on the way down and afterwards. Could perhaps be heavier in body. Overall, it is worth a try and it is guaranteed to make you pucker!

On tap at Pike brewery.  Pours dark brown hue with a tanned, thick head and much lacing.  Aroma is of espresso, roasted, malt and some dark fruit. Medium, smooth body. Coffee, dark fruit, toasted malt and earthy hops fill the mouth.  Quite complex, well done stout.

Bottle. Fairly dark pour, not much head. Only a rim job left after a while. Aromas of barley and some dark chocolate. Taste is dark roast coffee and roasted barley. Nice bitter finish. Thin body, but well balanced.
Was very impressed by this beer. Pours super dark. With heavy head. Nice robust flavor. Goodbeer.

Courtesy of Secret Santa December 2010
Bottle:  The aroma consists of chocolate, espresso, and a touch of vanilla.  It pours a dark brown with no transparency and a small beige head.  The flavor starts with dark chocolate and just a touch of fruit.  The finish has moderate black coffee, burnt notes, and light pine.  Medium bodied with light carbonation.

Bomber. Pitch black with an inch of pillowy chocolate malt head. Lots of roasted malt, coffee and bittersweet chocolate fragrances in the aroma. The flavor starts with smoky roasted malt and espresso along with notes of dark chocolate, vanilla and herbal hops in the background. The mouthfeel is creamy and moderately carbonated with a dry, smoky finish. Its got all the characteristics youd expect from a quality Stout and packs quite a bit of flavor for 7% ABV.

Intensely dark, practically black with medium-brown edges and head.  Delicious, roasted, almost woody aroma thats just sweet enough to balance the roast.  A hint of light smoke.  Much lighter in the mouth than I expected, extremely smooth, with a hint of roasted (dark) chocolate-like bitterness.  Very wet, very roasted, and really good.  SO easy for such a dark, roasted beer.  Aftertaste of dark chocolate.  Lovely!

22 oz bottle.  Pitch black in color, large beige head that dissolved real quick.  Left light lacing. Nose of  chocolate with plenty of roasted and piney hops. Flavor is similar. Lots of roasts up front with a good amount of piney hops behind them. Nice lingering coffee bitterness with plenty of hops in the finish. Body is medium, creamy with a soft to lively carbonation and a dry finish.  A bit more bitterness then I like in a stout, but overall, a really fine stout.

Poured pitch black, seriously no light can escape. Nice foamy beige head that stays. Strong aroma of the finest dark chocolates, coffee, ash, dark fruits, oak cask, vanilla, hint of raspberry and tons of hops. Smooth texture in a dense body with medium carbonation. Strong on the palate, hops and roasted, burnt characters being the most dominant. Outstanding!

It pours a jet black with a 1 finger creamy tan head, it has some spotty lacing present.

On the nose I am getting some roasted malt and a little chocolate. I find it to be pretty boring to be honest.

The flavor is giving me some dark roasted malt, chocolate, hints of coffee. I am picking up a little warmth from the alcohol. It most of the things I like in a good stout but nothing really stands out. It seems to be a little thin for the style.

It finishes with a little lingering dark chocolate and a alcohol burning. All things said not a bad beer but nothing to write home about neither.

Shipped to me by my wife on a trip to Portland. Sampled from a 22 oz brown bottle this beer poured thick, black and oily iwth a small foamy brown head that lingered and produced good lacing. The aroma was strong chocolate syrup, licorice, floral hops and a touch of port wine. The flavor was dry, bitter and roasty with notes of licorice, port wine and floral hops and undertones of cocoa and wood. The finish was long iwth licorice, cocoa and floral hops lingering. Thick and creamy body. Interesteing.

22oz bottle from blutt59, thanks Bob! Pours a black body with a finger-width, dense and creamy, dark brown head that dissipates slowly and leaves a nice lacing. Aroma is big and rich, dark chocolates with plenty of roasts and piney hops. Some caramel, a light coffee, a few dark fruits and prunes, citrus, and a light charred wood. Flavor is similar. Lots of roasts up front with a good amount of piney hops behind them. Plenty of dark chocolates and char with some thin caramels, coffee, and a light wood. Pines give off a slight citrus and there is a hint of dark fruit before this finishes very dry with lots of roasts, char, and a light, but distinct piney hop. Light-medium bitterness before leaving a very lengthy aftertaste following a medium-thin, very smooth body and soft, creamy yet somewhat lively, medium-light carbonation. Overall, an excellent stout. Tons of bold roasts and char with a nice piney hop. Lots of dark chocolates offer just a light sweetness, but balance nicely and give this a thinner feeling body that I feel works really well. This is definitely my kind of stout!
On tap at the brewery. Poured black with a dark brown head. Aroma was chocolate, coffee, and roasted notes. Medium bitterness and lightly sweet. Medium oily body with a light coffee finish.

Poured dark black with a frothy mocha head.  Nice aroma with coffee and nutty, roasted notes.  Nice full body with coffee, chocolate and plenty of roasted and malty flavors.  Nice beer...would recommend.
UPDATED: MAY 30, 2011 Very rich roasted deep stout, has a dry aroma and palate, worth a try

650ml bomber, 2009 edition, it is 7% alc.

Pours into my American pint glass with a dark brown/black and only hints of light on the edges when held to light, it is very dark. The head looks nice and is caramally tan and leaves some nice lacing.

It smells roasty, chocolatey, carmally, and fruity. There is a slight hop note to it but is is very faint.

Taste has alot of coffee and bittersweet chocolate. It is dark and roasty, a good example taste-wise for this style. The mouthfeel is ok, a bit watery, then carbonated, but it is true to the British style of doing it.

It is hugely drikable for the abv.

Overall a great beer right here, not my fav style but this makes me enjoy it.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 02-25-2010 01:10:47

22oz bomber.  Opaque black with a steady beige-brown head.  Big, sweet, roasty, chocolate aroma.  A pretty nice Stout, thick specialty malt tones, quite rich.  Quite above par for the style, this has all the big taste of an Imperial Stout without the cloying stickiness or brutal ABV.  Bigtime chocolate flavor.  Well done.

Appearance: solid black with an espresso crema head which. Head fades into a lovely collar while bubbles linger in the middle. Swirls with crema spots and a slightly thicker collar.

Nose: tarry and roasty. Brewers licorice, tar and char, dates, and black bread. Thick and sticky. Nutrient rich top soil, fudge, melted bakers and black chocolates. Charcoal. More brewers licorice and dates.

Palate: thick and rich, soft and creamy with a massive dose of char tar and burnt goodness in the back. Black root, brewers licorice are followed by tart meaty dates in the back. Burnt front to middle with tart meaty dark fruits dominating back with dry ash in finish drying the palate while inducing thirst. Pure cacao nibs and bakers chocolate in the breath. Burnt wood and charcoal underneath. Flavors are seamless as they melt into and out of each other.

Final Thoughts: a fine standing stout indeed. In Florida at least Pike Pub & Brewery is exclusive to the Total Wine brand of liquor/wine/beer superstores. If you want some and you dont live in Seattle, Washington then you know where to go. Tell them Kristyn sent you.

Poured from big bottle.  Excellent aroma dominated by dry cocoa, with a hint of coffee.  Stout black, hardly any head.  I taste cocoa, molasses, licorice, coffee, smoke , hops.  Seems in between dry and sweet.  Good finish.  A very enjoyable stout.
user_location: York, SC via NJ, South Carolina, USA

text: Pours deep dark brown.  Aroma is dark chocolate, coffee and roastyness.  Taste is sweet with some bitters like dark chocolate, also a little smokey.  Very light mouthfeel and very easy to drink.

Bottle 650 ml  
Aroma smoky oily roast, hint of coffee, some alcohol, hint of soy sauce, salt and burnt wood.
 Appearance  dark brown with creamy beige top. Some lace. 4-.
Flavor and Palate : medium bodied. Soy sauce , dark malts with smoky roasted feel. Decent yet felt bit uninspiring.

{thoughts} Wonderfully dry but hampered by a monotone molasses character in the flavor.

{elements} Deep black hue; thick, tan cream. Rich roast, dark chocolate, dark cherries and molasses aroma. Moderately sweet, soft cherry-like acidity, firm bitterness; big, dominant molasses flavor along with a sulfurous tinge and some espresso. Medium-full bodied, slick texture, full carbonation.
 22 oz bottle.

Colour is typical, or as expected - very black with dark head. Nose: Sugary presence with oatmeal, raisin, stale coffee grounds, snap peas. Taste: Medium sweet, heavy bitter, medium sour. Vanilla abundant, burnt oak, over-ripe red grapes, late Sprite, long and powerful bitter finish. Alcohol presence seems like more than 7% abv. Not as thick on the palate as I expected.

Bottle. Black bodied with a short, fading brown head. Aroma is roasted malt, caramel, light licorice, coffee, smoldering wood and dark chocolate. Taste is dark chocolate, burnt chocolate cake, coffee, roasted malt, light bitter hoppiness, and soft smokiness. Body is medium-full with a rich, smooth carbonation. Ends with more roasted malt and coffee complimented with more smokiness, chocolate, fruit notes on the far back end and light cake notes.

22oz bottle from Specs.  Pours a nearly black body with some mahogany highlights.  Topped with a lasting, bubbly head that leaves lots of lacing.  Aromas of freshly roasted coffee, roasty and some bittersweet chocolate.  Flavor is coffee forward, cocoa, some smoke, dusty and lightly sweet.  Nice lingering coffee bitterness in the finish.  Fine, soft carbonation with a medium mouthfeel thats slick and lightly coating.

Nearly black with a tiny brown head that laces beautifully. Aroma of chocolate, soy sauce, roasted malt, and a little bit too much wood. Flavor is full, roasted and chocolate malty, with a little wood flavor coming through. Body is full and smooth and a little dry. The smell isnt the greatest, but overall, this is a nice beer.
Bottle pours a jet black brew with a thin brown head. Roasted malt scent with some chocolate and soy. Taste is roasted malts, coffee and smoke. Very nice creamy feel. Great!

Bottle. Poured black color with an average brown frothy head that mostly lasted with excellent lacing. Moderate toasted chocolate malt aroma. Medium to full body with a smooth texture and flat carbonation. Medium to heavy dark chocloate sweet flavor with a medium to heavy bittersweet finish of moderate to long duration.

nice formidable stout with plenty of malt and has a hop character that comes off spicy. dark tasting oily slick brew with some texture and light brown head. dark rye bread like as it is chewy and like flavored. impressive because it is a simple full bodied ang genuine full flavored brew with no gimmick.
Draft at Pike Pub in Seattle, WA.  Stout on steroids!  Plenty of hops with a big kick of malty body; some alcohol burn as well.  Goes great with a cold, windy Seattle afternoon.

Bomber. Rich black, big thick brown head that fades to a thin cap. Smells of milk chocolate and dark fruit, maybe prunes. Sharp, pleasing mouthfeel welcomes in a coffee-forward flavor with a more bitter than normal (for style) finish. Leaves me feeling like I chewed on coffee beans...in a good. A bit too much flavor profile to be a "session" beer, but amazing flavor complexity for a 7% stout.

650 ml bottle at Garrison Ale House. Opaque dark brown colour with a fully diminishing frothy tan head. Fruity, vinous, coffee and light chocolate aroma. Big roasty coffee, chocolate, and vinous fruit flavours with a bittersweet vinous, fruity, and lightly roasty finish. Full bodied, creamy, rich, and smooth mouthfeel. Tasty stout.

650 ml. bottle. Pours a medium lasting mocha colored head, with light lacing, over a blackish brown (SRM 40) opaque body.....nose is light coffee, chocolate, bit of soy, bit of Marmite, light herb hop.....taste is dry to start, then light coffee, chocolate, beef, soy arrive, with a medium hop bitter finish....mouth feel is thick, carbonation adds a creamy texture. This is a well made Stout. It has the right nose and flavors and the lovely mouth feel. It is not quite an Imperial, but is excellent none the less. BJCP 7/3/15/5/8

Bottle. Moderate to heavy malt aromas of burnt, dark chocolate and strong coffee, moderate herbs and resin for the hops, moderate earth for the yeast with hints of tar, prune and faint vinegar. Head is small, frothy with bigger bubbles, brown with good slippery lacing and good legs, and is mostly diminishing. flavor starts lightly sweet and acidic, then finishes lightly acidic and heavily bitter. Palate is medium, creamy with a soft to lively carbonation and a chalky finish. Bold, potent aromas followed by full strength flavors makes this an exceptional Stout.

22 oz. bottle- Pours almost pitch black with a tan head that settles to a rim around the glass, the aroma has chocolate malt and some caramel or sweet sugar. The flavor is robust roasted coffee, some smoke and chocolate, then a mild bitterness lingers after the swallow. I dont know why but I didnt think this was going to be that great, just a run of the mill stout, but this is a very complex and flavorful stout. Creamy mouthfeel, this almost tastes like a sweet stout, like it has lactose sugars or something added, good beer.

Black pour with a tan head.  Aroma consists of coffee, dark chocolate, light anise.  Body is medium full with moderate-low carbonation, high and dry bitterness balanced nicely with dark roasted malt and moderate sweetness.  7% is hidden well.  A very delicious beverage here!
Bottle pours a jet black brew with a thin brown head. Roasted malt scent with some chocolate and soy. Taste is roasted malts, coffee and smoke. Very nice creamy feel. Great!
Sampled @ pikes.  Dark opaque brown with thin tan head.  Aroma of sweetened coffee, flavors of nice roasted barley and cocoa, good maltiness in the finish.  Drinkable brew.
Bottle. Crude oil black with a bit brown froth. Licorice and chocolate notes. Quite creamy mouthfeel, full-bodied, leaves with a oilslick on the tongue - in a good way. Satisfying aftertaste.

UPDATED: OCT 26, 2011 Small vintage update Oct 26, 2011.  Same vintage, last bottle enjoyed a year later.  Stronger dark fruit notes of black currants, raisins, figs & plums as well as anise in this one.  Still extremely good if not better than before.  Held up very nicely for a year.  Super tasty stuff at a great price!

Original review September 12, 2010:
22oz bottle, unknown date.  Pours medium bodied dark brown with a good brown head, leaves some fine intricate lace and holds a faint cap and small ring.  Aroma is all roast and chocolate, quite strong, some semi-sweet and milk chocolate, heavily roasted malts, some smoke, some coffee, a hint of vanilla.  Flavor comes in with a lot of coffee, good roasted malts, chocolate, a bit of dark fruit, lightly sweet with bitterness from the roast to balance, maybe a bit of citrus hops as well.  Smokiness picks up a lot as it warms up.  Mouthfeel is smooth and creamy, medium body, low carbonation, but not heavy like an Imperial Stout.  Very nice, very robust Stout, big aroma and flavor on this one.

Aroma 8, Appearance 4, Taste 7, Palate 4, Overall 16, Score 3.9

I first had this a long, long time ago at the brewery in Seattle.  Pre-rate beer days.  Happy to get to have it again.  Pours a very lovely black with a compact tan head that lasts well before fading into a ring.  Aroma is standard chocolate and coffee.  Flavor is chocolate and molasses, hint of coffee and dark fruit.  Balancing bitterness.  A very nice stout.
From a bottle poured black with a small amount of head.  Strongtoasted malty flavor with a lingering coffee finish.
Pitch black big tan head... complex aroma fruits coffee choc not too much roast... flavor follows suit, a touch creamy... medium full
Nice lightly smoky medium bodied stout.  Absolutely drinkable if slightly too bitter, this is a damn solid beer for the price and one Id happily drink again.

Black Black body, just a thin ring of small bubbles around the edges.  Dark roasted aroma, rye bread, chocolate. Flavors of roasted coffee dark , a lingering bitterness.  Nice feel in the mouth feel.  A very tasty beer.

Bottle. Pours black with a thick tan head...looks promising. Aroma is chocolate, burnt raisins, dark fruits, and booze. Flavor is every flavor thats in the aroma; except all of those flavors are burnt (yes that means that the raisins were burnt twice). Light/medium palate but some nice warmth. Overall its solid.

2010-07-05. Black body with a good sized brown head, light lace. 4+ Pleasant roasty aroma, dry dusty character and light coffee and cocoa. 7+ Flavour is much more dry than expected, bitter roast has notes of very dark cocoa - like a 100% cocoa chocolate bar. Smooth palate is nice but still very light for a stout in my opinion. Good. On tap at Pike Place brewpub, Seattle

The aroma is burnt and malty with coffee, chocolate, and molasses. The appearance is dark brown with a tan head. The taste is like the aroma with an incredibly bitter finish. The palate is typical for a stout. Overall the beer is interesting but not that great, just average.

$3.99 Bomber. Opaque with a lasting creamy ring of bubbles and frosty lacing. Nose is chocolate chip cookie dough, berries, oatmeal, char, coffee, dark chocolate. Heavy body is drinkably watery, smooth and sweet, but well-balanced by the roast . Tastes of hickory-smoked milk chocolate, espresso, oats, tart berry, light sour cream, and charry wood. Extra overall point for the nice price.

22oz bottle.  chocolatey aroma with notes of cookie and toast.  black under a small, creamy, tan head.  flavor is roasty with bitter unsweetened dark chocolate.  palate is chalky and dry.  medium bodied.  unsweet and bitter.  i would like a little sweetness.
Wow! velvety mouth feel, pours black with a dark brown head. first impression is of chocolate, roast malt & a little bit of hops. good beer, will get it again.

22oz bottle, BLACK label.  Oh My Lord.  This beer couldnt pour any darker!  Black color, light brown head.   Looks like the darkest bar of chocolate ever made.  Long lasting head, nice lacing.  Aroma of roasted barley with a touch of licorice.  Mostly roast, some BBQ, distant molasses.  The head wont go away.  Flavor is smooth, creamy, malt.  Loads of roasted barley, some cacao nib, smoke, and a touch of coffee bean.  Finishes with a roasted bitterness and a nice hop pine character, and also a light licorice.    This is one of the BEST STOUTS Ive ever had.

shared bomber on 7/31/10.  deep black pour with a 1/4" tan bubbly head.  big roasted malt nose with coffee and chocolate notes.  medium to big body with more roasted malts, coffee, chocolate and a solid level of bitterness.  silky smooth body with tons of flavor.  roasty, bitter finish.  nice price.  nice stout.

Bomber from grocery store in Washington state on my way into Canada.  Enjoyed at downtown Vancouver hotel.  Pours into tiny hotel glass mostly black with some quality frothy beige head formed of tiny bubbles and leaving nice lacing.  Aroma of dark roasted malt, smoke, roasted salted nuts, dark chocolate.  Flavor is dark chocolate (but not sweet), campfire, ash, espresso.  Velvety-creamy mouthfeel with long lingering roasty-bitterness and coffee.  A good straightforward stout full of flavor -- this is smooth and quite easy drinking.  (393, 354)

Bomber, label differs from Ratebeer picture, this is the "extra stout".  Not bad, not outstanding, a bit light in the body department hence the lack of an imperial description.  Middle of the road all the way around.

Bomber from Total Wine in Orlando, $3.99. Poured jet black with a decent brown head. Left a lot of lace. Aroma of deep roasted malts and some chocolate. A touch of raisin and mild smoke as well. Flavors consist of roasted malts, and smoke. A subtle fruity sourness blended into the espresso bitter finish.Super smooth and medium mouthfeel, good carbonation. For the cost of this bomber I was expecting much less. What a pleasant surprise. I bought three bombers of other beers from this same brewery. I am now looking forward to them immensely.
22 ounce bottle purchased at Total Wine Pembroke Pines, FL for $3.99 Very good!

Bottle at a tasting brought by me courtesy of presario.
Appearance : Deep black with a big creamy brown head.

Aroma : Roasted malt, lots of oily hops. Notes of liquorice. quite sweet.

Taste : Very roasty and quite hoppy. Rich and tasty.

Overall : Pretty nice stout. Nice roastiness. Quite good.
Bottle with many thanks to changeup45. Pours black with tan head. Nose is heavily roasted chocolate malts and coffee grounds. Taste is burnt chocolate malts, coffee grounds and smoke.

Bomber from Total Wine in Kennesaw, $3.99.  Poured jet black with a decent brown head.  Left a lot of lace.  Aroma of deep roasted malts and some chocolate.  Some subtle smoke in there too.  Flavors consist of roasted malts, smoke and an espresso like bitterness.  Super smooth and full mouthfeel, perfect carbonation.  This one was quite a surprise for how much it cost.  Finishes way dry with a lingering roastiness that hangs around for awhile.  Very good.

Weak dark roasted malt and charcoal aroma with licorice hints. Black, viscous, with a thin brown head, decent lacing. Dry, yet strong flavor of charcoal, smoke, and ash.  Finishes more tart, malty, and with black pepper. This should be wonderful with swedish meatballs. Very nice. Im beginning to like this brewer.

22 oz. bottle from Total Wine in Chesapeake, VA.  Dark brown, nearly black, pour with a creamy tan head.  Roasted malt, coffee, and dark chocolate aromas.  Big, I mean huge, smoky dark chocolate flavor.  Rich and roasty.  Quite nice overall but perhaps a bit overpowering with just how rich this is.
I had this on tap at the Pike Brewery while on vacation in Seattle.  Very chocolatey and nutty, black frothy head, full bodied, very good.  Nuff said!
Dark pour  with a brownish foam. The aroma had notes of chocolate and coffee bean. The flavor was sort of dry but bitter notes came through in very end. It was good but not super great.

Deep pitch black coloured body, even when held to the light - nothing gets through. Hardly any head - some minor bits of tan head on top though. Aroma of fresh hops up front, roasted malt, chocolate, a touch of coffee and even some cherries and a touch of milk. Rich full-bodied; Deep chocolate flavours, roasted malt, anise and drying hops are all very noticeable. Aftertaste shows a lot of burnt sugar flavours, drying hops, some alcohol and a good dark chocolate ~70% cacao flavour. Overall, a nice beer and a solid stout - on the border of too much, but this is just about right! I sampled this 65 cL bottle purchased from Total Wine in McLean, Virginia on 25-May-2010, sampled at home in Washington on 06-June-2010.

Pours a black colour with a small mocha head. Aroma is fairly malty with dark chocolate, molasses, toast and some coffee prevalent. Taste is of chocolate and roasted malts with a nice dry bitterness to it. Full bodied, thick on the palate, good carbonation and a long finish. Overall quite a good stout.
tap at the brewery.  pours a clear deep brwon.  leaves spotty lace.  Aroma of maple syrup, black licorice, bread, and toast.  flavor is coffee, roast, cocoa.  pretty solid. good beer.

Bottle via Ritzkiss. Nice appearance; Black body with lasting brown head. Aroma of milk chocolate, old coffee and funky blackberries. Also, some wet herbs ... strange. Flavors of sour blackberries, chocolate and roasted grain. Palate is thin with a bitter dry finish. Getting better as it warms but still a letdown.

Comes out of the bottle a rich, oily, opaque sable with a thick and fairly persistent fine-bubbled tan mead. Aroma is rich and smoky with firm tones of quality coffee and brown sugar - most inviting. Flavor is even better than the aroma - richly of roast fine coffee, unsweet chocolate and molasses, the flavors I like best in a stout. It is only slightly sweet and has a touch of bitterness. Texture is thick, smooth, oily and tingly. This is one lip-smacking stout, worth seeking!

On tap at the brewpub.  Pours a very dark brown with a nice tan head.  Nose is chocolate, coffee, roasted malts.  Taste is smooth and quite dry.  Roasty with burnt coffee.  Finished dry and bitter with more toasted malts.  Overall a great stout.  Complex and very well executed.

22oz bottle 
Appearance: Pours thick black with a nice frothy dark tan head, nice lacing left in the glass 
Aroma: Dark chocolates & coffee, some smokiness 
Taste: Silky chocolate and coffee, roasted malts. 
This is a very enjoyable stout. I enjoyed the silky mouthfeel while still having a small hop bite in the finish.
Pretty impressed. Amazing for the ABV. Tastes and feels like an imperial. Very smooth mouth feel to it. Loved the smokiness to it. Amazing full body.

bottle poured a dark black in color with a coating of heavy brown head when poured with some force. aroma has roasted malt, chocolate, tobacco, mild coffee, and some faint hops. thick mouth feel with low side carbonation that coats well. flavor gets a bigger roast, chocolate, light bitterness, and some mild coffee. this bottle was bought with a 2007 barley wine and has some oxidation so this is probably a bit aged as well.

22 ounce bottle courtesy of daknole. Pours a very dark brown color appearing an opaque black in the glass. Medium frothy brown head. Decent head retention and lacing. Aroma of chocolate with lots of dark, roasty leathery tobacco notes. Taste is dark, dark roasted malts, leafy bitter hop notes, tobacco, coffee. Fairly bitter. Smooth, creamy, medium-full bodied.

Bouteille de 22 oz partagée lors dune dégustation Ratebeer Montréal chez MartinT. Arôme: Odeur de café et de chocolat. Apparence: La couleur est noire opaque. Présence dun mince col beige mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de café avec une pointe de chocolat et de noix. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Faible effervescence en bouche. Présence de café en arrière goût. (Rating #2853)

UPDATED: JUL 12, 2010 Pike Brewing Company--Pike XXXXX Stout--1997 22 oz. Bottle.  6.50% ABV.  (4.0 / 5.0)  

Pike Brewing Company--Pike XXXXX Stout --1998 12 oz. Bottle.  6.50%.  (4.0 / 5.0)  Excellent! 

Pike Brewing Company--Pike XXXXX Stout--1999 12 oz. Bottle.  6.50% ABV.  (4.75 / 5.0)  Spotted at The Ballard Market 10/10/99.  Rich chocolate head with Espresso aroma.  Hazy deep dark black color. Pike Brewing Company--Pike XXXXX Stout--Limited Release 2000-2001--2000 12 oz. Bottle.  6.00% ABV.  (3.75 / 5.0)  Clear dark opaque black color.  Tan Espresso head.  Thin lace.
